result.execSummary:
The defendant Allison M. Ganley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to Probation today.
Court will accept early discharge by request of Department of Corrections if defendant has followed Compas and has done everthing required.
Concurrent with: 14CF208 - Count 3, 14CM174 - Count 1 and 14CF143 Count 1.

miscConds.notes:
Eligible for expungement on all files.
Must petition the court for expungement.

timeConds.notes: Conditional time - banked for use by Probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allison M. Ganley
